H0.text: How much adult fish gained on average when the same nutrient was added to their diet is the additional information needed to determine whether the nutrient is affecting the growth of the fish, after a scientist observed that the fish gained an average of 3 kilograms in the first year when the nutrient was added to their diet just after hatching.

H1.text: How much newly hatched fish in this species gain in the first year without the nutrient in their diet is the additional information needed to determine whether the nutrient added just after hatching, which caused fish to gain an average of 3 kilograms in the first year, is affecting the fish's growth.

H2.text: How much of the nutrient is available for the fish species in their natural surroundings is the additional information needed to determine whether the nutrient is affecting the growth of the fish.

H3.text: How much other species of fish gain in the first year when the nutrient is added to their diet is the additional information needed to determine whether the nutrient is affecting the growth of the studied fish species, which gained an average of 3 kilograms in the first year after the nutrient was added just after hatching.

A4.text: Thus, when everything else except for one intervention is held constant, researchers can certify with some certainty that this one element is what caused the observed change.
